newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary farmers say Monday road blockades likely.
newsitem.headline: Hungary farmers say Monday road blockades likely.

text.p: Hungarian farmers said on Thursday that government tax concessions were not enough to dissuade them from blockading main roads for three days next week.
"We have doubts that we will be able to agree by Monday," Gyozo Zsilka, member of a committee of farmers told Hungarian television after talks with Agricultural Minister Frigyes Nagy.

The farmers presented a petition last week demanding withdrawal of tax and social security measures introduced on January 1 and threatening to paralyse the country for three days from Monday with at least 25 road blocks outside key towns.
The government said on Thursday that it approved changes to relieve farmers from some tax and administrative burdens and was ready for talks with farmers to prevent the blockade.

"The government hopes that those who plan the demonstration, will take into consideration the readiness which the government showed for a compromise," Elemer Kiss, secretary of state for the prime minister's office, told a news conference.
However, Kiss said that the government would not reinstate last year's tax and social security contribution rules.
Agricultural minister Nagy told the Television he believed that the government would agree with the farmers about most points. I see a chance for resolving some 80 percent of the problems," he said.
